title: Watermelon Granita
ingredients: 2½ cups watermelon, rind and seeds removed, cut into pieces
instructions: In a saucepan combine the water, sugar, and lemon juice and bring the liquid to a boil over moderate heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.  Simmer the syrup for 5 minutes and let it cool.

In a blender purée the pieces of watermelon and transfer the purée to a large bowl.  Stir in the cooled syrup and then pour the mixture into a freezer tray and freeze it until it is firm but not frozen hard.  Transfer the mixture to a bowl and beat it smooth.  Again transfer the mixture back to the freezer tray and to the freezer.  Freeze the mixture for 3 hours more, or until it is firm.
Take from the freezer and let the freezer tray stand at room temperature for 5 minutes, or until it is just soft enough to scoop.
Remarks:  You may wish to use food coloring to enhance the granita’s color.
Source:  Gastronomie Sans Argent, Granitas, Gourmet Magazine, September 1978.
